frame.name: Within_distance
frame.definition:
<def-root>As is usual for locative relations, the location of the <fen>Figure</fen> is specified as being inside a region defined relative to the <fen>Ground</fen>. In this case, the region measures outward from the <fen>Ground</fen> with a width specified by the <fen>Distance</fen>.
<ex>The number of <fex name="fig">large galaxies</fex> <t>within</t> <fex name="dis">5 million light years</fex> is three. <fex name="gro">DNI</fex></ex> <ex><fex name="fig">What</fex> <ment>'s</ment> <t>within</t> <fex name="dis">100 miles</fex> <fex name="gro">of you</fex> ?</ex> <ex><fex name="fig">Two of Russia's long-range bombers</fex> flew around Iceland last Friday -- <m>coming</m> <t>within</t> <fex name="dis">striking distance</fex> <fex name="gro">of the United States</fex> for the first time in five or six years .</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Ground
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Ground</fen> serves as a basis for describing the location of the <fen>Figure</fen>, as inside a region measured outward from the <fen>Ground</fen> and of a width specified by <fen>Distance</fen>.
<ex>Our galaxy is just one of thousands that lie within 100 million light years. <fex name="gro">DNI</fex></ex> <ex>We allow no civilians <t>within</t> 50 feet <fex name="gro">of these aircraft</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Figure
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Figure</fen> is perceived as located relative to a certain <fen>Ground</fen> location.
<ex><fex name="fig">I</fex> am <t>within</t> spitting distance of one of the finest farmer's markets in the area.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Distance
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Distance</fen> between the <fen>Ground</fen> and the borders of the region within which the <fen>Figure</fen> is located.
<ex>The childhood leukaemia risk is doubled for children living within <fex name="dis">100 metres</fex> of high voltage.</ex>
</def-root>

lexUnit.name: within.prep
lexUnit.definition: COD: not further off than (a particular distance).
